title: Revealing the Decoherence and Dephasing of Intra- and Inter-layer Excitons in MoS2 via Temperature Dependent Spectroscopy
content: The successful isolation of graphene has led to an immense explosion of research into many different varieties of 2D materials. One such family that has been studied extensively due to their unique properties is the transition metal dichalcogenides (TMDs). With properties such as strong light-matter interactions, spin-orbit coupling, and valley-selective circular dichroism, TMDs have many potential applications being used as transiters, sensing devices, or photodetectors [1]. The characterization of these 2D materials has proved to be imperative in determining the quality of crystals (number of defects, etc) and understanding the impact these have on the underlying physics.
